Module com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.common
Package com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.common.net

Class SocketSetting<V>

java.lang.Object
com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.common.net.SocketSetting<V>
Type Parameters:
V - the specified value type
public final class SocketSetting<V> extends Object
A setting of a specified value type to be applied to a socket.

  • Method Details

    • newInstanceFrom

      public static SocketSetting<Object> newInstanceFrom(String s)
      Returns a new SocketSetting of the Object value type from the provided String. The provided String must be the name of the SocketSetting followed by an equal sign (=) followed by the value that can be parsed for the SocketSetting. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if any part of the provided String is invalid.
      Parameters:
      s - the provided String
      Returns:
      a new SocketSetting from value type Object of the provided String

    • newInstance

      public static <V> SocketSetting<V> newInstance(String name, V value)
      Returns a new SocketSetting of the specified value type with the provided name and the provided value. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided name is invalid.
      Type Parameters:
      V - the specified value type
      Parameters:
      name - the provided name
      value - the provided value
      Returns:
      a new SocketSetting of the specified value type with the provided name and the provided value

    • newInstance

      public static <V> SocketSetting<V> newInstance(String name, V value, String doc)
      Returns a new SocketSetting of the specified value type with the provided name, the provided value, and the optionally provided documentation. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided name is invalid.
      Type Parameters:
      V - the specified value type
      Parameters:
      name - the provided name
      value - the provided value
      doc - the optionally provided documentation (can be null)
      Returns:
      a new SocketSetting of the specified value type with the provided name, the provided value, the optionally provided documentation

    • newInstanceWithParsedValue

      public static SocketSetting<Object> newInstanceWithParsedValue(String name, String value)
      Returns a new SocketSetting of the Object value type with the provided name and the parsed value from the provided String. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided name or the provided String is invalid.
      Parameters:
      name - the provided name
      value - the provided String
      Returns:
      a new SocketSetting of the Object value type with the provided name and the parsed value from the provided String

    • newInstanceWithParsedValue

      public static SocketSetting<Object> newInstanceWithParsedValue(String name, String value, String doc)
      Returns a new SocketSetting of the Object value type with the provided name, the parsed value from the provided String, and the optionally provided documentation. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided name or the provided String is invalid.
      Parameters:
      name - the provided name
      value - the provided String
      doc - the optionally provided documentation (can be null)
      Returns:
      a new SocketSetting of the Object value type with the provided name, the parsed value from the provided String, and the optionally provided documentation

    • applyTo

      public void applyTo(DatagramSocket datagramSocket) throws SocketException
      Applies this SocketSetting to the provided DatagramSocket. An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown if this SocketSetting does not support application to the provided DatagramSocket.
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the provided DatagramSocket
      Throws:
      SocketException - if an error occurs in applying this SocketSetting to the provided DatagramSocket

    • applyTo

      public void applyTo(ServerSocket serverSocket) throws SocketException
      Applies this SocketSetting to the provided ServerSocket. An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown if this SocketSetting does not support application to the provided ServerSocket.
      Parameters:
      serverSocket - the provided ServerSocket
      Throws:
      SocketException - if an error occurs in applying this SocketSetting to the provided ServerSocket

    • applyTo

      public void applyTo(Socket socket) throws SocketException
      Applies this SocketSetting to the provided Socket. An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown if this SocketSetting does not support application to the provided Socket.
      Parameters:
      socket - the provided Socket
      Throws:
      SocketException - if an error occurs in applying this SocketSetting to the provided Socket
